items.text: short and driven away behind square. Smart placement, as Williams had to do a fair amount of running to get to the ball and to his right, hence allowing for two to be taken
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 2 runs

items.text: defended off the front foot
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: tries a late cut, and a poor bit of fielding from Tiripano at short third man gives them an easy single
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: driven, but stopped by short cover
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.preText: Muhi: "The XI is still undecided, BD like their right left combination but I feel that Liton is the most capable of playing the no.3 role : 1. Tamim 2.Imrul 3.Liton/Soumya 4.Shakib 5.Mushfiq 6.Mithun 7. Mahmudullah 8. Mashrafe 9. Mehidy/ Saifuddin 10. Mustafizur 11. Rubel/Hider/Saifuddin"
items.text: stopped by the bowler in his follow-through as the bastman drove straight
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.preText: Sean Williams into the attack now. Coming in from around the wicket to the two lefties
items.text: strays down the leg side, and it seemed like it came off the bat, but has been given as wides. They also ran two
items.shortText: Williams to Imrul Kayes, 3 wides

items.text: driven through the offside, where Jarvis does the cleaning up at the cover boundary
items.shortText: Williams to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.preText: James: "I like the idea of a "consistent top order batsman" in ODI's. Unfortunately there are very few batsmen who consistently make runs in any format."
items.text: straight to Raza at short midwicket
items.shortText: Williams to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: looks to sweep this, but plays it straight to H Masakadza, who is at short fine leg
items.shortText: Williams to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: driven down to long on and picks up an easy single
items.shortText: Williams to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: played away on the on side, but straight to the fielder
items.shortText: Williams to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: goes on to the back foot and flicks the ball away and picks up an easy single in the process
items.shortText: Williams to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.preText: Ron: "Of course James, I guess you are deliberately excluding Kohli!!
items.text: comes forward and defends this
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.preText: Raiyan Ferdous : "Tamim is an auto choice. BUT who will open with him? And whom will you drop from liton, kayes and soumya? All of them have played reasonably well with kayes being by far the best."
items.text: driven well, but fielded at short cover
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: dropped down the leg side, and Kayes seemed tempted to have a dab at it. He lets it be, and it is called wide
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 1 wide

items.text: drives this through the off side with soft hands, wide of the short cover fielder. Easy single
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: down the leg side again. Sarkar was looking to sweep this one but missed by a fair margin
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Soumya Sarkar, 1 wide

items.text: that nearly snuck through his defence. Took an inside edge, and somehow contrived to miss his leg, and the stumps
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: opens the face of the bat and takes a single down to Tiripano, who is stationed at short third man. Needed to be quicker to hurry up the non-striker
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: cut away but straight to backward point
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.preText: Imrul Kayes, by the way, has brought up 300 runs for the series. Hemant tells me only Tamim Iqbal has scored more runs in a 3-match ODI series.
items.text: played away defensively on the offside
items.shortText: Williams to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: comes down the wicket and smashes this way out of the ground to bring up FIFTY runs. It was probably a half-tracker anyway from Williams, but he did well to get to the pitch of it and smash it over midwicket
items.shortText: Williams to Soumya Sarkar, SIX runs

items.text: this time he top-edges a sweep, and it falls wide of Masakadza. Lucky there
items.shortText: Williams to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: driven off the back foot, but fielded by short midwicket
items.shortText: Williams to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: moves across to the onside and flicks it away for a single to the sweeper on the midwicket fence
items.shortText: Williams to Imrul Kayes, 1 run
